summary: Supervisor with experience in corrosion control and aircraft painting, including personnel supervision, safety, hazmat management, and government clearance; proficient in surface preparation, masking, plastic media blasting, painting, and finishing on various aircraft types.

experience.title: Supervisor
experience.description: Supervised corrosion control facility; directly responsible for maintenance and upkeep of twelve aircraft paint schemes; supervised three employees; respirator qualified; managed tool control, hazmat inventory, EPA-regulated waste handling, and safety procedures; contributed to 0% accident rate; performed masking, sanding, painting, and finishing on aluminum aircraft components.

experience.title: Administration Clerk
experience.description: Prepare, type, and route correspondence and reports; organize and maintain files; receive office visits and handle telephone communications; operate computers and word processing; maintain records and official publications.

experience.title: Aircraft Worker
experience.description: Worked on P-3s, T-34s, T-44s, and F/A-18s; masked surfaces; performed plastic media blasting to remove paint and corrosion; stripped and repainted surfaces; prepared surfaces with chemical solutions; mixed and thinned paint; used spray equipment and power tools; performed masking to prevent damage during stripping.

experience.title: Aircraft Painter
experience.description: Painted Boeing 737-777 and Airbus 320; masked surfaces; applied primer and coatings; followed blueprints for stencils and placards; used rollers and brushes; stripped paint with chemicals; prepared surfaces and achieved consistent color/finish.

experience.title: Aircraft Painter
experience.description: Worked on Airbus 319 & 320; masked and repainted surfaces; applied primer and coatings; prepared surfaces; used rollers/brushes; followed color charts and finish specs.
